pullRequest.title: Save graph plugin to include a file path parameter #53
pullRequest.bodyText:
Description of the Change
Added an enhancement that allows the user to hardcode in a filepath to save a graph to within the saveGraphPlugin.

Alternate Designs

Why Should This Be In Core?

Benefits

Possible Drawbacks

Verification Process

Applicable Issues

nodes.bodyText: More a personal preference but maybe naming it "saveFilePath"? Up to you there
maybe change this to a log instead
And separate it from graphIdParameter - they should be in distinct blocks for readablitily.
It also doesn't look like you're adding it to the parameters object?
The second argument here should be a parameter id, not a default value. You can set a default value below using Parameter.setStringValue.

I think I must have confused you so my apologies :). I was ok with the variable name being filePathParameter (makes sense and matches the string you were building with). I was thinking more changing the name set here from "SaveGraphPluginFilePath" to "saveFilePath". It keeps the plugin part out of the name which would be consistent with most plugin parameters.
It doesn't matter too much in this case - but generally you want parameter names to be structured as human readable text, ie. "Save File Path".
